statements.name: PROC MVPDIAGNOSE
statements.description: invokes the MVPDIAGNOSE procedure and specifies input data sets
statements.help:
PROC MVPDIAGNOSE <options>;                 
	BY  variables;                 
	CONTRIBUTIONPANEL < / options>;                 
	CONTRIBUTIONPLOT < / options>;                 
	ID  variables;                 
	SCOREMATRIX < / options>;                 
	SCOREPLOT < / options>;                 
	TIME  variable;

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies an input SAS data set that contains process measurement data for a Phase II analysis; if you specify a DATA= data set, you must also specify a LOADINGS= data set but not specify a HISTORY= data set

arguments.name: HISTORY=
arguments.description: specifies an input SAS data set that contains process variable data that are augmented with principal component scores, multivariate summary statistics, and other calculated values; you cannot specify both the DATA= option and the HISTORY= option

arguments.name: LOADINGS=
arguments.description: specifies an input SAS data set that contains eigenvalues, principal component loadings, and process variable means and standard deviations that are used to compute principal component scores and multivariate summary statistics for a Phase II analysis

arguments.name: MISSING=
arguments.description: specifies how observations that have missing process variable values in the DATA= data set are to be handled

arguments.name: AVG
arguments.description: specifies that missing values for a given variable be replaced by the average of the nonmissing values for that variable

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: the default, excludes from the analysis any observation that has missing values for any of the process variables

arguments.name: PREFIX=
arguments.description: specifies the prefix that is used to identify variables that contain principal component scores in the HISTORY= data set; the default prefix is Prin

arguments.name: RPREFIX=
arguments.description: specifies the prefix that is used to identify variables that contain residuals in the HISTORY= data set; the default prefix is R_

statements.name: BY
statements.description: produces separate analyses of observations in groups that are defined by the BY variables

statements.name: CONTRIBUTIONPANEL
statements.description: displays a paneled layout of the contribution plots for each observation in the input data set, up to a maximum specified by the MAXNPLOTS= option

arguments.name: MAXNPLOTS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of contribution plots to be produced by the CONTRIBUTIONPANEL statement; the default is 50

arguments.name: MAXNVARS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of process variable contributions to be displayed in the paneled layout; by default, all contributions are displayed

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of columns in the panel layout

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of rows in the panel layout

arguments.name: ODSFOOTNOTE=
arguments.description: adds a footnote to the plot

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS FOOTNOTE statement as the plot footnote

arguments.name: ODSFOOTNOTE2=
arguments.description: adds a secondary footnote to the plot

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE2
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS FOOTNOTE2 statement as the secondary plot footnote

arguments.name: ODSTITLE=
arguments.description: specifies a title for the plot

arguments.name: TITLE
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS TITLE statement as the plot title

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses all titles from the plot

arguments.name: DEFAULT
arguments.description: uses the default title

arguments.name: ODSTITLE2=
arguments.description: specifies a secondary title for the plot

arguments.name: TITLE2
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS TITLE2 statement as the secondary plot title

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of contribution plots displayed

arguments.name: SPE
arguments.description: bases the contribution plots on the SPE statistics, the default if a LOADINGS= data set is not provided

arguments.name: TSQUARE
arguments.description: bases the contribution plots on the statistics, the default if a LOADINGS= data set is provided; you must specify a LOADINGS= data set to create contribution plots

statements.name: CONTRIBUTIONPLOT
statements.description: produces a contribution plot for each observation in the input data set, up to a maximum that is specified by the MAXNPLOTS= option

arguments.name: MAXNPLOTS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of contribution plots to be produced by the CONTRIBUTIONPLOT statement; the default is 50

arguments.name: MAXNVARS=
arguments.description: specifies that only the n contributions that have the greatest magnitudes be displayed in each plot; by default, all contributions are displayed

arguments.name: ODSFOOTNOTE=
arguments.description: adds a footnote to the plot

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS FOOTNOTE statement as the plot footnote

arguments.name: ODSFOOTNOTE2=
arguments.description: adds a secondary footnote to the plot

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE2
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS FOOTNOTE2 statement as the secondary plot footnote

arguments.name: ODSTITLE=
arguments.description: specifies a title for the plot

arguments.name: TITLE
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS TITLE statement as the plot title

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses all titles from the plot

arguments.name: DEFAULT
arguments.description: uses the default title

arguments.name: ODSTITLE2=
arguments.description: specifies a secondary title for the plot

arguments.name: TITLE2
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS TITLE2 statement as the secondary plot title

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of contribution plot to be created

arguments.name: SPE
arguments.description: specifies that the contribution plots be based on the SPE statistics, the default if a LOADINGS= data set is not provided

arguments.name: TSQUARE
arguments.description: specifies that the contribution plots be based on the statistics, the default if a LOADINGS= data set is provided; you must specify a LOADINGS= data set to create contribution plots

statements.name: ID
statements.description: specifies variables to display in tooltips when you create HTML output and specify the IMAGEMAP option in the ODS GRAPHICS statement; also, the first variable that is specified provides the labels for points in score plots

statements.name: SCOREMATRIX
statements.description: produces a matrix of score plots, each of which is a scatter plot of scores for a pair of principal components

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the α value for prediction ellipses that are overlaid on the score plots.; the default is 0.05

arguments.name: ELLIPSE
arguments.description: requests that prediction ellipses be overlaid on the score plots

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a variable in the input data set that is used to group the points in the score plots

arguments.name: LABELS=
arguments.description: specifies whether points in the score plots are labeled; the labels are the values of the first variable listed in the ID statement, or the observation number if no ID statement is specified

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: labels all points

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: the default, labels none of the points

arguments.name: NCOMP=
arguments.description: specifies the number of principal components whose scores are plotted in the matrix; by default, the matrix contains score plots for all principal components

arguments.name: ODSFOOTNOTE=
arguments.description: adds a footnote to the plot

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS FOOTNOTE statement as the plot footnote

arguments.name: ODSFOOTNOTE2=
arguments.description: adds a secondary footnote to the plot

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE2
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS FOOTNOTE2 statement as the secondary plot footnote

arguments.name: ODSTITLE=
arguments.description: specifies a title for the plot

arguments.name: TITLE
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS TITLE statement as the plot title

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses all titles from the plot

arguments.name: DEFAULT
arguments.description: uses the default title

arguments.name: ODSTITLE2=
arguments.description: specifies a secondary title for the plot

arguments.name: TITLE2
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS TITLE2 statement as the secondary plot title

statements.name: SCOREPLOT
statements.description: produces a single score plot, which is a scatter plot of the scores that are associated with a pair of principal components

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the α value for a prediction ellipse that is overlaid on the score plot; the default is 0.05

arguments.name: ELLIPSE
arguments.description: requests that a prediction ellipse be overlaid on the principal component score plot

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a variable in the input data set that is used to group the points in the score plot

arguments.name: LABELS=
arguments.description: specifies which points in the score plot to label with the values of the first variable listed in the ID statement, or the observation number if no ID statement is specified

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: the default, labels all points

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: suppresses all point labels

arguments.name: OUTSIDE
arguments.description: labels only the points outside the prediction ellipse, if you specify the ELLIPSE or ALPHA= option

arguments.name: ODSFOOTNOTE=
arguments.description: adds a footnote to the plot

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS FOOTNOTE statement as the plot footnote

arguments.name: ODSFOOTNOTE2=
arguments.description: adds a secondary footnote to the plot

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE2
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS FOOTNOTE2 statement as the secondary plot footnote

arguments.name: ODSTITLE=
arguments.description: specifies a title for the plot

arguments.name: TITLE
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS TITLE statement as the plot title

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses all titles from the plot

arguments.name: DEFAULT
arguments.description: uses the default title

arguments.name: ODSTITLE2=
arguments.description: specifies a secondary title for the plot

arguments.name: TITLE2
arguments.description: uses the value of the SAS TITLE2 statement as the secondary plot title

arguments.name: XCOMP=
arguments.description: specifies an integer x that identifies the principal component whose scores are plotted on the horizontal axis of the score plot; the default is 1

arguments.name: YCOMP=
arguments.description: specifies an integer y that identifies the principal component whose scores are plotted on the vertical axis of the score plot; the default is mod (x, j) + 1, where x is the value that is specified by the XCOMP= option and j is the number of principal components in the model

statements.name: TIME
statements.description: specifies a numeric variable that provides the chronological order or time values for measurements in the input data set; if you do not specify a TIME variable, the observation number from the input data set is used instead
